ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
0=None of the time; 1=A little of the time; 2=Some of the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=All or almost all of the time; -8=DON'T KNOW; -7=REFUSED

ElementDescription: Michigan Critical Events Perception Scale raw score
Michigan Critical Events Perception Scale mean score
Michigan Critical Events Perception Scale results significant
MCEPS - Michigan Critical Events Perception Scale - Raw Score, Fully imputed using Freeze 1b cohort
Notes: Sum of all five MCEPS Likert scales plus 5, if all MCEPS Likert scales have response >=0

ElementDescription: MCEPS - Michigan Critical Events Perception Scale - Indicator
Notes: MCEPS - Experienced peritraumatic dissociation Indicator, Mean RS greater than 3
